reason: The Riesz-Kantorovich theorem as stated in Section 5.3.4.3 requires: (1) a real vector space V, (2) a generating cone K, (3) a subspace W, (4) a linear functional f: W → R with f ≥ 0 on K ∩ W. The claim omits hypothesis (1)-(3) and only mentions the generating cone. This is insufficient - the theorem requires MORE than just a generating cone. It requires the specific extension setup (subspace, functional positive on cone intersection). The claim is therefore INCOMPLETE and potentially misleading.
